message.content:
I'll generate a complete income statement based on the transaction data provided. Let me analyze this step by step.

## Step 1: Calculate Main Business Revenue
I need to sum all sales transactions to get the total revenue.

Looking at the data, all entries with "type" as "Sale" represent revenue transactions. Let me add these up:

```
Sum of all transactions where type = "Sale" = 839.44 + 459.92 + 242.39 + 13198.32 + 2658.43 + 22421.8 + 1071.1 + ... (all other sales)
```

Adding all sales amounts: 780,097.11

## Step 2: Calculate Cost of Goods Sold (COGS)
COGS will be calculated from the "cost_amount" column in the sales transactions.

```
Sum of cost_amount from all sales = 600 + 300 + 150 + 8000 + 2000 + 14400 + 750 + ... (all other sales)
```

Adding all cost amounts: 541,880.00

## Step 3: Calculate Administrative Expenses
This is the sum of all transactions where type = "Administrative Expenses":

```
Sum of all administrative expenses = 226.27 + 954.16 + 826.27 + 932.87 + ... (all other administrative expenses)
```

Total Administrative Expenses: 15,474.05

## Step 4: Calculate Selling Expenses
This is the sum of all transactions where type = "Sales Expenses":

```
Sum of all sales expenses = 208.92 + 335.46 + 996.42 + 957.5 + ... (all other sales expenses)
```

Total Sales Expenses: 10,353.57

## Step 5: Calculate Depreciation
This comes from transactions with type = "Depreciation":

```
Sum of all depreciation = 45745.8 + 69766.11
```

Total Depreciation: 115,511.91

## Step 6: Calculate Financial Expenses
This is the sum of all transactions where type = "Financial Expenses":

```
Sum of all financial expenses = 238.17 + 200.69
```

Total Financial Expenses: 438.86

## Step 7: Calculate Interest Income
This comes from transactions with type = "Interest Receivables":

```
Sum of all interest receivables = 445 + 445 + 445 + ... (all other interest receivables)
```

Total Interest Income: 11,337.80

## Step 8: Calculate Tax Expense
The tax expense is not directly available in the transactions, but we can extract it from the tax_amount field in sales transactions:

```
Sum of all tax_amount from sales = 41.97 + 23 + 12.12 + 659.92 + ... (all other tax amounts)
```

Total Tax Expense: 38,984.85

## Step 9: Generate the Complete Income Statement

Main Business Revenue: 780,097.11
Total Revenue: 780,097.11
Cost of Goods Sold: 541,880.00
Total Cost: 541,880.00
Gross Profit: 238,217.11
Administrative Expenses: 15,474.05
Selling Expenses: 10,353.57
Depreciation: 115,511.91
Financial Expenses: 438.86
Total Expenses: 141,778.39
Interest Income: 11,337.80
Profit Before Tax: 107,776.52
Tax Expense: 38,984.85
Net Profit: 68,791.67

Now I'll provide the solution in the requested format:

```json
{"solution": {"Main Business Revenue": "780097.11", "Total Revenue": "780097.11", "Cost of Goods Sold": "541880.00", "Total Cost": "541880.00", "Gross Profit": "238217.11", "Administrative Expenses": "15474.05", "Selling Expenses": "10353.57", "Depreciation": "115511.91", "Financial Expenses": "438.86", "Total Expenses": "141778.39", "Interest Income": "11337.80", "Profit Before Tax": "107776.52", "Tax Expense": "38984.85", "Net Profit": "68791.67"}}
```
